name: endurable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact that something difficult, unpleasant, or painful is possible to deal with : The workload was barely endurable, but the experience was priceless. Many patients with osteoarthritis need aspirin or another pain reliever to make life endurable. See
endure
More examplesFewer examplesSome people get little satisfaction from their work and find it endurable only by virtue of the salary it provides.The show is not just endurable, but actually fun for the adults as well. What makes failure endurable is loving the work you do and being convinced of its value.
